message_1: If sin(x) = 0.5, what is the value of x in degrees?
message_2:
There are two values of x in the range of 0 to 360 degrees for which sin(x) = 0.5. These values are:

x = 30 degrees (since sin(30) = 0.5)
x = 150 degrees (since sin(150) = 0.5)

So, the values of x are 30 degrees and 150 degrees.
